samples.input: Who created the R programming language?

messages.content: Who created the R programming language?

content.text: R was created by Ross Ihaka and Robert Gentleman at the University of Auckland, New Zealand. They began the project in the early 1990s, with the first official release in 1995. The name "R" comes from the first letter of the creators' first names. R was developed as an implementation of the S programming language, with added lexical scoping semantics inspired by Scheme.

R was created by Ross Ihaka and Robert Gentleman at the University of Auckland, New Zealand. They began the project in the early 1990s, with the first official release in 1995. The name "R" comes from the first letter of the creators' first names. R was developed as an implementation of the S programming language, with added lexical scoping semantics inspired by Scheme.

samples.input: In what year was version 1.0 of R released?

messages.content: In what year was version 1.0 of R released?

content.text: Version 1.0.0 of R was released on February 29, 2000. This first official release came after R was initially created in 1993 by Ross Ihaka and Robert Gentleman at the University of Auckland, New Zealand. The development of R began as an implementation of the S programming language, and it evolved through several beta versions before reaching this milestone 1.0 release in 2000.

Version 1.0.0 of R was released on February 29, 2000.
